name: ThreatStream
description: Integrates a variety of generic, reputation and investigative actions from the Anomali ThreatStream threat intelligence platform

organization_id.description: Organization ID for filtering incidents when polling
organization_id.verbose: Organization ID is mandatory while polling and is used for filtering the incidents to ingest.

first_run_containers.description: Maximum number of incidents to poll in the first run of the scheduled polling

actions.description: Test connectivity to ThreatStream by querying the intelligence endpoint
Get information about a file
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this is because ThreatStream has no information on that file.

actions.description: Get information about a given domain
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this may be due to the format of the domain. Try excluding any subdomains (namely www). If there is still no information found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that domain. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data.

actions.description: Get information about a given IP
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, then it is because ThreatStream has no information on that IP. ThreatStream, however, may still have Passive DNS (PDNS) information on it, which can be found in extra data.

actions.description: Get information about a given email
Get information about a URL
actions.verbose: If nothing is found, this is because ThreatStream has no information on that URL.

actions.description: Execute a whois lookup on the given ip
actions.verbose: ThreatStream returns whois info as a raw string (present in the raw field) which the app will then attempt to parse into the output. Depending on the contents of the raw string, it may not be able to parse all or any of the required fields.

actions.description: Execute a whois lookup on the given domain
actions.verbose: ThreatStream returns whois info as a raw string (present in the raw field) which the app will then attempt to parse into the output. Depending on the contents of the raw string, it may not be able to parse all or any of the required fields.

example_values: Successfully retrieved whois info but unable to parse all required fields

actions.description: Update incident in ThreatStream by ID number

intelligence.description: Comma separated list of intelligence IDs to associate with the incident - Note that this overwrites, not appends

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to update on the incident

incident_id.description: ID number of incident to update

actions.description: Import observables into ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
• For importing observables of type 'URL', 'IP' and 'Domain', user must provide indicator type in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>"}).
  • For importing observables of type 'Email', 'File', user must provide indicator type and confidence value in the field parameter (e.g - {"itype": "<indicator_type>", "confidence": <confidence_value>}).

fields.description: JSON formatted string of fields to include with the observable

example_values: Successfully sent the request for importing the observable

actions.description: Add a tag to the observable

source_user_id.description: ID of user to associate with tag

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to associate with this Observable

tlp.description: TLP to assign to each tag
tlp.verbose: A TLP of red will make the tag private for the user's organization.

actions.description: Download pcap file of a sample submitted to the sandbox and add it to vault

id.description: ID of report associated with the pcap to download

actions.description: Detonate file in ThreatStream

platform.description: Which platform to run the detonation on - Ex: WINDOWS10x64. Default is 'ALL' which will run the detonation on all platforms

vault_id.description: Vault id of file to be detonated

classification.description: Classification of the sandbox submission - private or public

actions.description: Detonate url in ThreatStream

platform.description: Which platform to run the detonation on - Ex: WINDOWS10x64. Default is 'ALL' which will run the detonation on all platforms

classification.description: Classification of the sandbox submission - private or public

actions.description: Retrieve detonation status present in Threatstream
Retrieve detonation report present in Threatstream

example_values: PNG image data, 400 x 220, 8-bit gray+alpha, non-interlaced

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for

container_id.description: Container IDs to limit the ingestion to

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days.

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now.

actions.description: Run observables query in ThreatStream
actions.verbose:
For providing the query parameter, please form a valid search string using the Anomali filter language (as seen on the advanced search page) and then, convert it into a valid JSON string as shown in the example here. e.g. Anomali filter language-based search string = modifed_ts__gt=2018-01-10&status=active has to be provided in the query parameter as { "modifed_ts__gt": "2018-01-10", "status": "active" }
If offset is provided in the 'query' parameter, it will be overwritten by the offset value provided in the 'offset' parameter.

query.description: Search string in JSON format using the Anomali filter language (as seen on the advanced search page)

order_by.description: Field by which the query results will be ordered

offset.description: Record offset (used with paging, when returning many results)

example_values: imported by user 13487 Confirmed as false positive
